attributes.name: Ember.DAG
attributes.description:
DAG stands for Directed acyclic graph.

It is used to build a graph of dependencies checking that there isn't circular dependencies. p.e Registering initializers with a certain precedence order.

methods.description: Adds a vertex entry to the graph unless it is already added.
methods.name: add

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the vertex to add

methods.description: Adds a vertex to the graph and sets its value.
methods.name: map

params.name: value
params.description: The value to put in the vertex.

methods.description: Connects the vertices with the given names, adding them to the graph if necesary, only if this does not produce is any circular dependency.
methods.name: addEdge

params.name: fromName
params.description: The name the vertex where the edge starts.

params.name: toName
params.description: The name the vertex where the edge ends.

methods.description: Visits all the vertex of the graph calling the given function with each one, ensuring that the vertices are visited respecting their precedence.
methods.name: topsort

params.name: fn
params.description: The function to be invoked on each vertex.

methods.description:
Adds a vertex with the given name and value to the graph and joins it with the vertices referenced in before and after. If there isn't vertices with those names, they are added too.

If either before or after are falsy/empty, the added vertex will not have an incoming/outgoing edge.
methods.name: addEdges

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the vertex to be added.

params.name: before
params.description:
An string or array of strings with the names of the vertices before
                     which this vertex must be visited.

params.name: after
params.description:
An string or array of strings with the names of the vertex after
                     which this vertex must be visited.
